column3: While here, it looks like the "#include <optional.h>" header should be added.
utACK 049feabf289ace817a3da62fe84942d0200b8f0b\n\nNo harm in doing this now, although I expect we'll swap our usage of boost::optional for std::optional very soon after moving to c++17.
@promag , could, but, OTOH, they are two different (although related) changes.
ACK 049feabf289ace817a3da62fe84942d0200b8f0b: diagnostics signal to noise is increased by getting rid of false positives
@promag did you mean to ACK the head commit\n049feabf289ace817a3da62fe84942d0200b8f0b?

Similar issues have a long history in the repo:
- #15292
- #18052
- #18198

Particularly, this warning was [discussed](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17954#discussion_r395695797) in #17954.

Considering that switching to C++17 is around the corner, and `std::make_optional` has no known drawbacks, I'd suggest to postpone addressing compiler warnings until using `std::make_opt

I'm with @hebasto \nConcept NACK, my reasoning are: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/18198#issuecomment-602050441\nI'd prefer silencing those warnings until we can switch to `std::optional`

Going to merge this, otherwise we'll have to close a flood of issues complaining about the warning. I'll make sure to remove the workarounds after branch-off, as neither the workarounds nor MakeOptional is needed with C++17
